quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Year and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, seinfeld, factory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On April Fools Day in 2001, BBC broadcast a spoof documentary about spaghetti crops.
Who wrote the book Festivus: The Holiday for the Rest of Us?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Allen Salkin

questions.question: What version of the Porsche 911 replaced the 964 body style from late 1993 to early 1998?
Ben and Jerrys had an ice cream flavor called Festivus.
In the Seinfeld episode The Strike for whom does George Costanza work?
It is believed that April Fools Day was first celebrated around what year?
Until the late 1500s, March 25th was considered the beginning of the year.
According to lore, if a man is fooled by a pretty girl, he is destined to marry her or have a long relationship with her.
In Scotland April Fools Day is celebrated for two days.
McLaren and General Motors teamed up from 1989 to 1990 to build this factory turbocharged passenger car.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pontiac Grand Prix GTP

questions.question: It is generally accepted that the April Fools Day tradition started in this country.
According a legend all April Fools pranks must be perpetrated by this time on April 1st.
The first recorded April Fools joke was pulled in London, England and involved inviting the public to The Tower of London to see these animals being washed.
In this European country April 1 is called April Gowk.
How do the French call the first day of April?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aprils Fish

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Bronxite and Bronx
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the title of the official in charge of running the The Bronx borough?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bronx  Borough President

questions.question: Which one of these persons is not a Bronxite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spike Lee

questions.question: The early 90s Chevy Cavalier came equipped with an optional V8 engine.
Which of these actors is not a Bronxite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicholas Cage

questions.question: Which one of these famous personalities is a Bronxite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Joel

questions.question: Which 90s sports car starred in a TV show named after it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dodge Viper

questions.question: Who wrote the poem The Bronx , No Thonx?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ogden Nash

questions.question: Which one of these political or military figures is a Broxnite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colin Powell

questions.question: Which of these persons is not a Bronxite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carlos Santana

questions.question: Considered by many to be the predecessor of the Dodge Neon SRT-4, this automobile featured a manual transmission and high output turbocharged engine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dodge Shadow R/T

questions.question: Which one of these famous people is not a Bronxite ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ann Rice

questions.question: In the early 90s the Ford Taurus came with a high output V6 engine and optional 5 speed manual transmission. In the late 90s Ford put a V8 under the Taurus hood.
Which of these entertainment personalities is a Bronxite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Regis Philbin

questions.question: In 1977, this President visited the poorest parts of The Bronx, giving people the impression that the entire borough was a slum.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. Carter

questions.question: This car was featured in the hit movie The Saint starring Val Kilmer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Volvo C70

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Iowa and State
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, iowan, coin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This famous Iowan became one of Hollywoods most popular actors. In the film Angel and The Badman he plays a man named Quirt Evans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Wayne

questions.question: The US has minted $3.50 coin.

In times when African Americans were usually turned away from flight schools because of their race, Herman Banning, an Iowa State University student, became the first African American flyer to obtain a federal pilots license.
The Latin inscription below the pyramid, on the back of the dollar bill says NOVUS ORDO SECLORUM, which means a new order has begun.
Until 1974 the value of the United States dollar was tied to and backed by ...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gold and silver

questions.question: On the back side of the 1 dollar bill we can see  an ancient Egyptian pyramid, beneath a triangle containing a glowing eye. This symbols origin is...?
Parts of the 1996 disaster movie Twister were filmed in Iowa. Bill Paxton stars in the movie, partnered by this actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Hunt

questions.question: It is generally unknown that ten dollars are referred to as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An eagle

questions.question: The state of Iowa borders Minnesota on the north, Missouri on the south, Nebraska and South Dakota on the west, and Wisconsin and Illinois on the east.  Which river forms the eastern boundary of the state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mississippi River

questions.question: One of these claims about  the US currency is false. Can you spot it?

options.text: Dollar bills are easy to counterfeit.
Coins do not have their values inscribed with a number.
Blind people cannot tell dollar bills apart because of their similar designs and texture.
Both the one cent (penny) and the five cent (nickel) are larger than the dime, which is worth ten cents.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dollar bills are easy to counterfeit.

questions.question: This company in Cedar Rapids, Iowa was founded in 1901, as a result of the merger of three separate companies.  In 1969, they acquired Fisher-Price, a toy company.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quaker Oats

questions.question: If you had $500 bill, up to what year could you have used it?
Iowa is named after the local Native American Iowa people. What is the states nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hawkeye State

questions.question: Iowa is known for its unpredictable weather. What are the most frequent disasters that strike the state?
The dollar was chosen as the US monetary unit in this year.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and Continent
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which is NOT one of the official eight Australian States or Territories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coral Sea Islands Territory

questions.question: Was Dwight Eisenhower, the 31st president of the United States, was born in West Branch Iowa on August 10th 1874?
What is the capital of the Netherlands?
Lake Victoria in Sub-Saharan Africa is split among Tanzania, Uganda, and Rwanda.
What is the capital and largest city of Peru?
The capital of the United Kingdom is London.
What continent is the Gobi Desert in?
The official colors of Iowa are red, white, and blue (appearing on the state’s flag) and Iowas motto is, Our liberties we prize, our rights we will ____.
Icelands capital is Ice City.
In December 1981, General Leopoldo Galtieri seized power in this South American country.
Does Bolivia have 2 capitals: Sucre and Buenos Aires?
The Ohio, Monongahela and Allegheny Rivers merge in Piitsburgh, PA, at the location of this outpost, established during the Fench and Indian War (1755-1763).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fort Duquesne

questions.question: Vidkun Quisling was leader of this country during World War II.
The capital of Thailand is Bangkok.
The continent of Antarctica is surrounded by the South Pacific, South Atlantic and South Indian Oceans which collectively can also be referred to as the Southern Ocean.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Flag and Flags
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, japans, jackson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which countrys flag has the Latin motto Ordem e Progresso (Order and Progress) on it?
Which of these flags is the oldest still in use?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmarks Dannebrog

questions.question: Which country has the most colors on its flag that does not have any seal or brocade?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: Which country has a plain green flag?

options.text: None, the green flag is the official symbol of Green Peace

questions.question: How many stripes are there on the American flag?
Former Vice President Albert Gore Jr. was born March 31, 1948 in Washington, D.C. but he was raised in Carthage, TN.
The Dutch are sometimes called Oranje, which means the orange colored. What is orange on the Dutch flag?

options.text: The thin stripe with the Dutch motto

questions.question: All Nordic countries have a Scandinavian cross on their flags. Which statement is true about these flags?

options.text: The Swedish flag is the only one without any white.
The Finnish flag has the cross upside down.
Norway and Iceland have exactly the same flags.
Yellow is the dominant color of Scandinavian flags.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Swedish flag is the only one without any white.

questions.question: The Italian flag is green-white-red. What is the traditional color of Italian athletes in international competitions?
Japans capital is Osaka.
What is the shape of the Star of David, visible in the center of the Israeli flag?

options.text: It looks like a comet, with a head and tail

questions.question: Many European countries have a flag with three horizontal stripes, colored white, blue and red (in different orders or shades). Which country is not one of them?
Which of these nations has a flag not rectangular in shape?
Which two countries have flags with same patterns and colors, but in reversed order?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monaco and Poland

questions.question: Andrew Jackson was born on March 15, 1767 in Waxhaw, South Carolina. He moved to Tennessee as a young man. Andrew Jackson died on June 8th, 1845 in Nashville, TN at his home the Hermitage.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tn and Finger
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, heritage, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On which Sunday in May is Mothers Day celebrated in the USA and Canada?
Former US President Andrew Johnson ran away from his home in Raleigh, North Carolina with his brother to Greeneville, TN at age 18.
Hee Haw star Archie Campbell was born in Bulls Gap, TN.
Chad Pennington was a first round National Football League draft pick in 1998.
February is African American Heritage Month. What group is May associated with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asian Pacific Americans

questions.question: Writer Alex Haley was born on August 11, 1921 in Ithaca, N.Y. but move to Tennessee the year he was born.
Singer Dinah Shore, born Frances Rose Shore, was from Winchester, TN. She passed away from Ovarian cancer on February 24, 1994.
Cinco de Mayo is Mexicos Independence Day.
Dr. Benjamin Spock and Bing Crosby were born on the exact same day of May.
Buford Pusser was born in Finger, TN. He was a legendary Sheriff of McNairy County, TN from 1964 to 1970.
Actress Cybill Shepard was born February 18, 1950 in Memphis, TN.
Towel Day is celebrated in May in tribute to Kurt Vonnegut.
What is unique about the month of May?

options.text: No other month begins on the same day of the week as May.
It is the only  month with no holidays.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No other month begins on the same day of the week as May.

questions.question: Actress Annie Potts was born in Nashville, TN on October 28, 1953.
Memorial Day is observed on the 3rd Monday of May.
